reviews.review_msg: The course is tough, but he does a poor job of explaining the material and confuses students, especially with exam questions.  That said, he does provide "sample" exams, to help understanding.  Unfortunately, he "played favourites" and only helped those who he thought were bright.  Would not take another class with him again.

although, he knows a lot of concept about phil. however, it is not a good thing for the student. he expect his students had the same knowledge as he had. he never give us any practice before exams. in the midterm, even the TA said this question is not reasonable. even, he has a great knowledge, but he is not suitable to teach any class yet.

Jonathan Katz is an excellent logic professor. If you are interested in logic, you should definitely take it with him. He is very clear so you do not need to read the text (unless you don't understand it, which happened rarely, if at all).
If you are interested in logic and are good at it, Katz is a good prof.  Otherwise, you might find this course difficult.

If you took phil xx1 and did fine, this class will be easy for you. He teaches quite well as you do not have to read the textbook to be able to do the material. Overall, fair and nice professor. You're either in the top half of the class (80%+), or you're in the bottom half (50% or lower).

Fantastic guy. 4.8/5 should be a 5/5.

Easy to get along with when I went to office hours. Completely understood alternate pathways to solve questions and even encouraged me to use them. 

He cares alot about what he does and it shows. Made the class very enjoyable! 

Would vouch 100% and highly recommend. Fantastic human.

Very direct and clear at explaining things. Very much cared about students learning and was very clear about what would be on the midterm and final and gave us resources to prepare. He also has a soothing voice with a British accent NGL. Deserving of the 4.8/5 rating as of current timing, should be 5/5.
HAS A BRITISH ACCENT !!!!
Very easy to follow. Attending the TA session helps a lot.

Took 110 in Fall 2021, but still the best prof I've met at SFU so far. Tom is a great example of what it means to be a good prof. You can tell he knows his material, loves what he's doing and is good at what he does. Expect engaging lectures with humour, personal stories and fun puzzles. The course content is kinda difficult, but Tom makes it easy.

As other's mentioned, this class is not easy, but it is very enjoyable. Prof gives SO much info - recorded lectures, past exam examples, videos for specific topics by students request, useful homework, office hours, you name it. He truly cares about students and their well-being. Adds stories and humour to his lectures. Great TAs too! Best prof@sfu

Tom is a wonderful prof! You can tell he genuinely cares for his students and informs students about important school info too. That being said, the course is not easy. It is cumulative, so the material builds on top of the previous weeks. Definitely have to put lots of effort in understanding and practicing the concepts to get a good grade.

He is a great professor, really engaging and is really approachable (always there to help); however, do not make the mistake a lot of folks do because you want that Q requirement. The class is not easy, if you do not like math this is not for you. The further you go into the course the less you understand, do not make the same mistake I did.

Tom is an amazing professor that really tries to make the lectures engaging. However, if you are looking to take this course for a Q-req and hate math this course is still difficult. This class is not an easy A and you do have to put in effort by reviewing material, going to tutorial and completing the pass/fail assignments.
Tom is the best!

Dr. Donaldson is a tremendous professor who deeply cares about students. Now, the reason why the difficulty is a 4 is b/c you HAVE to do the work to do well. The reviews make it sound as though the class is a cakewalk that can be done by anyone: it's not! You need to be engaged, do the homework, and stay on top of things, otherwise you'll be lost.

Best logic prof at SFU. I am a history major who took PHIL110 as a Q credit and Tom made the subject interesting and accessible. Show up to lecture and study the practice midterms and you will get a good grade.

A respected British professor. Always comes with clear and amazing lectures. I literally attended every class not only to acquire the knowledge but also to hear his perfect London accent. He always welcomes students to attend his office hour and gives us a hand whatever in homework or quiz (sometimes he even invites us to have coffee and tea)
He comes to class prepared with detailed powerpoints. His lectures are very understandable. His assignments are relatively easy if you pay attention to his lectures.

Tom not only loves the topic he teaches, but loves the act of teaching. Takes the time to make extra puzzles/riddles thatll help you better understand class topics. Easy to pay attention during lecture because he sprinkles in jokes. Genuinely respects all of his students and will always welcome discussion and questions.

Some people have said this is a difficult course, but Tom makes it enjoyable and easy to follow along in lectures. His lectures are engaging and the concepts, well-explained. Slides are posted on canvas if you'd rather not show up. He's very open to questions AND gives out a practice mt/final which are both VERY similar to to the real thing :))

Tom is the best teacher I've ever met. He is really nice and hot. He teaches very slow and easy to understand. This course is kind similar to MACM 101 stuff. His exam is not hard at all as long as you listen and understand the lecture and do some practices. You will definitely be fine to get a great mark.

Tom's lectures were quite interesting and he's also very patient with students. Both the midterm and final were open book. I purchased the digital version of the textbook and I didn't read it at all, studying Tom's lecture slides and doing all the practices in tutorial is enough. Overall, an extremely fair and good course!

Easy easy class. I mean, I didn't show up for more than half of the classes and am still getting an A. He clearly loves what he teaches. Used to teach at prestigious universities. Ask questions if you don't understand and he will do whatever he can to help you

He is extremely nice and easy to follow. However I do feel as though we are taught more in the tutorials themselves. But he is caring with grades and takes into consideration a lot, would highly recommend his courses!

Tom teaches this class slowly, this is important as his pace allows his students to actually grasp the material, like people taking it for Q req. Phil 110 isn't a traditional phil class. The Logic in this course is an abstract but learn-able language. It WILL require practice, varying from person to person. If you practice you should do fine/well.

He was the author of the required book for the course which he offered for free and was pretty much enough to get through the course without really needing to attending lectures. You have to attend a min number of tutorials but recommend attending all of them. The last few homeworks and quizzes were kind of tough but overall a manageable course.

Great prof!! The course material is organized and easy to follow. Although the content is a bit dry at times, he tries to make things interesting. Overall, a pretty enjoyable class if you pay attention and put in some work. Clear instructions/expectations,,

Very nice teacher, never would turn a student's question down no matter how stupid, will go over concepts until everyone understands. This class is especially interesting if you speak up, he praises people who participate greatly.
Nice guy, easy course. Would definitely take another course with him.

He's very nice. Midterm1 and midterm2 are super easy. If you go to class, you can get at least A- on the midterms. MC on the final are hard and very confused. If you put effort into this class, you can get at least B for the overall grade
He's a nice guy. He is helpful, and replies emails in a short time and answers questions clearly. This course is definitely the easiest course i've ever taken!
He's a really nice prof. He's really helpful. He replied emails in a short time, and answers questions clearly. Definitely the easiest course I've ever taken at SFU.

Super easy course!Textbook is not so expensive, useful but not really required after midterm.One of his TA is harder maker.But all the things all good,Midterms are easy, of MC in final little bit hard.  easy A!
A nice guy. The content itself is pretty easy but the class is boring. You don't have to attend the lectures if you read the textbook yourself.

This was hands-down the absolute worst course I have ever taken, and Jill was hands-down the rudest, least available, least helpful, and worst profs I have ever had the displeasure of meeting. Do not take any classes with her. She is stuck up and selfish. Our class averages for exams were all below 30%. Gives no time on exams. Wish I could give a 0

I do just fine at stats but couldn't crack this weird pseudo-programming philosophy. I passed the class & still have no idea how; lectures vary between horrifically byzantine & yawn inducing. No time for midterms, which are themselves a nightmare. Book isn't helpful, neither is she. Absolutely murdered my GPA. Abandon hope all ye who enter here.

There are lots of iclicker questions so participation in lectures is mandatory. Lectures move really fast so dont blink or youll miss something. TAs always say theyre confussed and stressed when you go for help. Grade scale/curve is TERRIBLE, you get little time to do exams, exams are marked SO HARD mc with a twist is absolutely horrible!
she was alright, not the best teacher but not the worst, i thoroughly enjoyed showing up to her classes, mainly because it was fun because of the students i got with my group!

this prof is the worst prof I ever had, she goes through materials really quickly, does not explain things well.  her lectures are boring ah... but u are encouraged to participant in lectures by doing iclicker quizzes, highly recommend u to do that so u can gain as much credit as u can even u dont know the answers, just randomly select one.

terrible class. biggest mistake. 1st class that ive ever done poorly in. tried very hard, attended hours etc etc, but still failed as her exams are BOGUS, insanely vague, misleading and marked unfairly. lectures also do not help, and concepts are poorly explained, if at all. trust me and DO NOT TAKE

Worst. Class. Ever. By far the most difficult class I have ever taken. Dr. Mc does a less than poor job at explaining concepts and ideas and tests are excruciatingly difficult with failing class averages. Unless you have a fetish for logic or this course is required for something, DO NOT TAKE IT...
She's a good prof. She's always available for extra help outside the class. Her midterms were fair. Do the homeworks, attend the lectures/tutorials and read the textbook you'll be fine.

She explains concepts POORLY. Lots of irrelevant talks going on during her lecture. She tries very hard to be funny but she is just not good at it. Questions on the exam are extremely vague. I have ABSOLUTELY NO idea what she is asking for!!  Her example does not captures the concept at all. So don t take PHIL110 with her!!
Dosen't go over terms well enough, but if you do your textbook readings you'll be fine

if u find math easy then maybe u'll do well, but the stuff didn't naturally make sense to me. Definitely practice & ask for help. Her lectures were good, but her tests were hard. Its the usual where in class it feels like 2+2 then on the exam its calculus. But like i said if u practice & ask for help u should be able to do pretty well. Use textbook

Taking PHIL 110 as an elective with Dr. McIntosh was the worst decision I could have made for my GPA and my sanity. Her lectures are hard to follow and she moves through material (particularly examples) extremely quickly. Expect lots of trick questions on exams. The marking scheme makes it very hard to do well, getting part marks is near impossible

Probably the worst decision ever to pick this class. The Class average for the first two midterms were less than 50%. The material itself is rather straightforward but the way she structures her tests make it nearly impossible to do well. Tries to trick you with every question, and the multiple multiple choice is brutal. Total GPA killer.

Easy to follow in class and tutorials are also easy, yet most everything learned is irrelevant on the test. The most convoluted and hardest exam Ive had in post secondary. Ive taken everything from physics/chem/calculus/poli sci/law/psych, so.. Tries to trick students at every question. Mid term % was 45, with the mode being 40 and median being 42

I felt like crying in this course. You don't need to attend the lecture because her notes are pointless anyways, and although the book makes the material easier to understand, her exams are difficult and the questions are ambiguous. Just... don't take this course.

I totally flunked this course because i slacked a little in the beginning.... DO NOT SLACK OFF IN PHIL 110!!! Its very difficult to catch up with the material! If you are not pumped about logic and philosophy, DONT think this is an easy course! the midterms are KILLER HARD! MUST BE DEDICATED TO STUDY and DO THE HOMEWORK in order to do well!

This is by far the worst class I have ever taken. This is a warning to all those who are taking this class as an elective or as a class of interest, DON'T. The midterms were hard and if you don't believe me then check the average marks for them. The average was below 50%. The questions were ambiguous and difficult to systematically decipher.
DO NOT TAKE THIS AS AN ELECTIVE. Her midterms are very hard. The book is horrible.  you need to put a lot of work in to it. Definitely not a gpa booster.

This is a hard class. Test avg is 50%. Being good at math will aid you in this course because logic is somewhat similar. The prof seems like a nice person but she gets pissed if she hears people talking during the lecture. Also the material is not very interesting, very very dry stuff.

Jill's exams are a bit tricky, but the grades are curved and everything works out nicely in the end. I'd much rather be challenged, get 85% on the exams and end with a good mark, than not be challenged and end up with the same mark. I really enjoyed the course and would recommend it to others.

Probably the worst class I have taken. The material is boring, the way that Dr. Mc taught it was boring and it wasn't exactly easy. Not a great class for GPA ****s like myself. I don't reccomend taking this class by any means. It doesn't really have much value, I found it hard to maintain a B and..

Absolute disaster.Notes and tutorial material do not relate in any sense to the exams.Exams do not test you on your knowledge;they are more of an IQ test.Expects you to know what and probably the only think she has learned (or thinks she has)in a semester.no kidding!so discouraging.Dont recommend
A wonderful teacher, but not particularly talented at writing concise exams. Take her class if you're interested in learning for the sake of learning rather than for the sake of boosting your GPA.

Not a great lecturer, goes off on tangents. As noted prior, tests tend to be waaay more difficult than notes. Uses multiple answer, multiple choice questions!!! WORST OF ALL...i found that there wasn't even enough time to think on the midterms, most people that i talked to in the class didn't finish
the worst prof I 've ever had .

Her explainatons are awful, she makes the material much more confusing and complex than it needs to be (thank god for the TA). Her exams are awful, study as hard as you want because it doesn't matter, she doesn't give NEARLY enough time and has NO sympathy.  I almost failed because of her.

She seems to be a good person however she gives very poor and over-simplified notes. Her lectures lack substance,plus half of each 50 minute lecture consists of going over and over and over upcoming assignments. I havent gained anything from her lectures
makes very good notes! speaks clearly and makes things easier to understand. great sense of humor and personality. nice taste in music :)

Best prof I've ever had, hands down. This man brought philosophy to life for me. He's very clear on what he expects from you, and how his tests will be broken down. Any who oppose him just didn't care for the material. It's not the simplist stuff to wrap your head around in the first place but with a different prof we'd be up the creek. Thanks!
she built my interest in Philosophy =)
Probably the least approachable professor I've had at SFU. The TA is even worse, doesn't understand the material well and cannot answer questions. Do not make the mistake of taking this class

He wrote his own textbook, which is super wordy, and tried to explain concepts in his own way but he failed. He explains the easiest concept through a complicated way and complex examples. Reading through the material, I am just trying to figure out what he is trying to express most of the time.
Him and Dr. Calico could be twins, he tried really hard even though the material is dry as toast.
Nic is more stand-up clown than professor â€” shallow lectures, arbitrary grading, zero real substance

Brilliant lecturer. Workload is very manageable. He drops hints about exams in lectures, so don't miss the last class before each exam for sure. Although attendance isn't mandatory, it was the best way for me to keep up. He may use some outlandish examples, but those are the ones that helped me remember concepts.

Attendance is required in the sense that you have to attend to keep up. Don't think you already know the material or that it is something you can pickup from youtube. Put in the effort and there's a big payoff.
Brilliant, kind and charismatic. High quality teaching. Do this course and at the end you will know you have achieved something substantial.
-1000. Ridiculous expectations
Say goodbye to all free time if you're taking his classes

I do just fine at stats but couldn't crack this weird pseudo-programming philosophy. I passed the class & still have no idea how; lectures vary between horrifically byzantine & yawn inducing. No time for midterms, which are themselves a nightmare. Book isn't helpful, neither is he. Absolutely murdered my GPA. Abandon hope all ye who enter here.
worst. prof. ever. scary, mean and dismissive. hard marker. avoid!
Very bad at explaining stuff. Nic tries to make the course and exams extra hard just to boost his ego
Does not explain concepts well. Nic is the worst teacher I've had
Nc stoo passionate about the subject. Expects students to dedicate all their time to his class. I feel like he gets a thrill out of torturing students with hard, tedious problems

Nic was phenomenal at teaching. He made all the content seem approachable. His extra practice exercises were key to my success because he has created an abundance of practice problems, with full solutions, which were similar to exam questions. I often came to his office hours, and I always left understanding the content.

Amazing lectures, Nic is so funny with very engaging and joke-filled lectures. I found the course itself very difficult, if you are thinking of it as an elective with no experience in computer science, I'd advise you to take a different course as Nic himself would say, this one requires a lot of practice at home.
Expects too much from students. Very dogmatic about his political views and frequently denigrates people and political views that do not align with his.
Boring lecturer. Reads off slides and doesn't add anything new. Don't attend his lectures waste of time. The course content itself is interesting but Nic is a bad prof he just rambles on and mumbles

Found course concepts and work interesting, but not my strong subject (have ASD) and was not doing well in beginning. Was able to get great tutor through TA. TA, tutor and professor extremely helpful. Prof was open to collaborating w/CAL advisor. Testing for all revised and improved, and bonus opportunities provided. Flexible, good intro class.
Nice guy, great professor. Really knowledgeable and knows how to teach.

I'm only rating this now, but took the class in summer 2016. He has a very strange personality and lectures are a bit bizarre. Also, he grades for a 100 level class as if you are in 4th year -- so, terrible and unfair. Doesn't go over basics enough and exams are Ridiculously difficult. If you are already an expert you have a chance.

I took PHIL 110 as an elective and it was the worst choice I've ever made because I'm horrible at deductive logic. But it's not Nic's fault. He let me retake my final after I accidentally missed it because I mistook 8:00AM for 8:00PM. AMAZING professor, but I would not take philosophy again.

Look here, Nic is a great guy but PHIL 110 is a hard course that should not be taken as an elective. Its too difficult and requires too much time to achieve mastery in the course. Nic is a great lecturer and the course is interesting, but it is going to be a barn burner if you're expecting to get an A in an 'elective'.  Avoid if you want an A.

Super funny and his lectures were only 1 hour and super interesting. The TAs he works with are pretty chill and participation wasn't required! Very interesting course but you just have to put some effort into studying. Exams not too difficult, but this course includes the saying "practice makes perfect".

The course itself is hard but Nic does his best to explain the material using fun examples. He also gave easy bonus marks throughout the course! He genuinely wants you to do well. Exercises in the textbook were of great practice but be sure to attend the lectures. Always found lectures to be enjoyable. Sad that the course is over, highly recommend.

Nic is a really great lecturer! Course can be quite tough but not a bad way to get a Q credit if you're looking to avoid math. I failed the midterm but was able to bring my final grade up to a B+. Average on final exam was low so Nic boosted grades as well. Textbook is confusing so make sure to attend lecture! Brad Z is an excellent TA as well.

Wow where do I start. I walked into that class thinking I'm going to hate it but he is so so so amazing at what he does that I walked out having learned so much, and with an interest in logic. Fantastic lecturer, genuinely cares, but still tough course. I am actually sad that the class is over.

Took PhilXXI and Phil110 with him. Found XXI to be easier. 110 was good too. His midterm is tough in the sense that we don't have enough time. Super interesting class. Really funny guy, and a a great person to talk to in his office hours. Genuinely wants you to do well in class, cares about his student.  Midterm and Final are moderately tough.

This course material requires a lot of practice, as it is a Q course. If you fall behind, then you may have trouble catching up as things build on each other. My issue with how this course is taught is that it progressed too quickly considering how it's only a 100-level/Q elective. This course is NOT impossible, but it is not easy either. Careful.
Very helpful prof
Explains the concepts well, and does of a good job of keeping dry topics relatively interesting. As long as you put in a little bit of work, the midterm and final will be simple.
First half of the course was relatively easy, but after the midterm it got much more difficult. He keeps his lectures fairly interesting with a bit of humour inserted.

From the jokes he made, to the same dress shirt he always wore, to his aggressively French accent, Nic's class was amazing. He clearly explained complicated topics in accessible ways, and very explicitly outlined what he' expected from you. DO THE PRACTICE QUESTIONS, you'll see the results. Overall, my favourite professor and class at SFU so far.

Funny guy, although proudly displays his own political views in classes, which might turn people off. Explain concepts very well and knows the material. Homework is light and discussed weekly in tutorials. Slides are good enough to replace textbook. Provides a massive question bank to practice for midterms and final which were reasonable and fair.

Hands down best prof I have ever had. The course itself is challenging but Nic makes it go like a breeze. His lectures are interesting and super useful as he explains everything clearly. I can't say enough good things about him and his class!

C: Phil 110 I: Instructor is Nic Fillian A: You will have an amazing time C ^ I -> A Therefore: A. Hands down the best professor at SFU. Does that mean this course is easy? Certainly not. However, Nic makes lectures fun, provides practice question for exams and will help you if you attend office hours.

As a person he is AMAZING! Loves his job clearly. The course was difficult not because he was a bad teacher but because it was just hard material to cover with no former knowledge on statement logic. I loved and hated it. If you practice a lot you will get a good grade! If you need this class I recommend taking it with him.

The best prof and best course I've ever had!!! Nic is just a gem and his lectures were honestly the highlight of my week. I enjoyed his class so much that I found myself doing extra studying just for fun in my spare time. Absolutely hilarious, so generous with his time and extra help, and so gifted with making course content understandable and fun

Hands down best prof I've ever had. Nic is really passionate about logic and philosophy, is literally HILARIOUS, and explains the concepts with relevant examples. The concepts are very tricky but he somehow makes them a piece of cake. If I could, I would take ALL my classes with him.

Nic himself is such great prof! He made class interesting and I felt like it went by too quickly. He knows what he's talking about and tries to make examples as relatable and fun as possible. However, PHIL110 is such hard class and if you don't do the reading and ask questions you won't pass.

Nice prof, terrible course. You must put aside previous "logic" when taking this course as it covers concepts you most likely never heard of. Very difficult to wrap your head around. Not the greatest Q credit you can take.
Great prof. Easy credit

Nic was a great prof. His lectures were organized and he added a lot of relevant humour. BUT THE COURSE IS HARD. Seriously. You got to put in a lot of extra practice at home to make it work. Fully regret taking it lol
Bruno Guindon is a logician who takes pride in his work. It is sad for me to say that his textbook and tests are not something he should be proud of. (Incredibly flawed)

loved bruno he was an amazing prof but the material itself was extremely hard to understand and needed lots of time outside of class to get an understanding of it. took this class hoping for an easy elective but turned out to be the hardest course of my semester, don't take unless ur prepared to spend a lot of time on the course

The prof isn't bad but the material is very hard. If you aren't good with memorizing different rules and all the diff ways you have to use them, don't take this class as a easy elective, also you need to spend 6-8 hours on this class on your own time and do the practice questions from the textbook. Overall, good prof but difficult class

Professor Guindon is a great guy and genuinely wants to see you succeed; however, the course material itself is difficult and requires a lot of time spent out of class to understand the content. tutorials are largely unhelpful, and the textbook did not help me understand the material. DO NOT take this class if you're looking for an easy elective.
Bruno was a great prof who was passionate about logic. This made it more fun to learn the content even though I found it to be quite difficult. Tutorials definitely made all the difference.

Dr. Guindon was a fantastic professor. The content can be quite difficult at times but between his clear lectures, help in office hours, and textbook (which he co-wrote), the material became very digestible. TA was a huge help as well in tutorial/office hours. Overall difficult but rewarding course, taught by a great prof who wants you to succeed.

Dr. Guindon is awesome. Logic is scary at first but he explains things really clearly. Lectures can be a bit speedy which can sometimes result in confusion but that's to be expected with the content. He's super helpful in office hours and wants you to do well, plus he's also just a very nice guy. Overall recommend him and the course!

Dr. Guindon is a wonderful professor. I was terrified coming into this course because of what I'd heard about the difficulties of logic but he really wants you to do well. The textbook is clear and helpful and during lectures he explains things super clearly. He makes learning logic fun even for a non-quantitive person like me! Definitely recommend

Difficult class - surprisingly so. If you get it, you'll be fine, but otherwise play a catchup game the entire semester. Bruno is helpful, all questions posed to him were answered in extreme detail to ensure understanding.

Bruno is a very good professor, he explains concepts clearly and really attempts to give students a chance to ask questions. He demonstrates regularly that he genuinely cares. However, it is hard to come up with questions when you do not understand what is going on. Be warned that this class has extremely difficult content, it is almost shocking.

Caution this course is very difficult. As the weeks go by it gets very hard to manage everything and keep up with both lectures and homework. Course material is not easy to grasp within one day and takes time before you understand it all. That being said, the prof is very kind and genuinely wants his students to succeed/ask for help.

Bruno is a very nice man but taking this course online was extremely difficult and I don't feel like his lectures/videos were very helpful at explaining the material. The class average was probably like 65% but it was curved thankfully. Take online with caution and be prepared to spend 12+ hours per week studying.
easy guy, like his work
worst philosophy class ever!!!!
No Comments
sounds funny.... kind of like a cartoon character

Jim is a caring and nice guy, he knows the class is struggling and will tweak some things for the students to succeed. Overall, this class was extremely difficult; his lectures are pretty good but it can still be a hard time to understand what's going on. Great prof, just a hard class.

Hes really engaged with students. I took this online during quarantine and he was super helpful in his lectures and would get back to me if I emailed him very soon, even over weekends. Hes a cheerful guy who genuinely cares and wants his students to understand what hes teaching. One of the few who actually show so much love for what they do!

Jim is definitely one of my favourite professors I've had. His lectures are amazing and he is super caring and considerate towards his students. He is super helpful during office hours and is very encouraging to people who ask questions in lecture. The textbook for this class was also free which was a bonus!

I really enjoyed Jim's lectures. As some people have mentioned, he uses extravagant hand gestures which, for me, is a bonus. His exams are straight forward. He only includes material that was introduced in lectures. He is very flexible to his students' needs, like when students needed more time to study he moved the exam to a class later.
really enjoyed his class. Jim is very enthusiastic about the material. also accessible outside of class and is really helpful. I would take another class with him.

Jim was okay. Because he's a new prof, his lack of practicing time management made the content really difficult to understand. My TA's the only reason I passed the class. I really liked Jim & he was helpful in office hours, but you HAVE to go to office hours & participate A LOT to do well. The course itself was a bigger issue than Jim.
do the work and study and you'll do well if you aren't an idiot
With that said, he can be very helpful and a good Professor for those that understand the subject I'm sure will excel.

PHIL 110 was one of the hardest subjects I've ever taken.It's kinda like boolean logic, so you need to have a computer type mind. I took it for my Q requirement dont recommend as an elective.  For ppl struggling like me you can still possibly pass. My first midterm was 12/36, second 15/36. depends on class aver. as he scales marks. I got C- in end.

The most professional professor I've ever had. His lectures are crystal clear and you can tell he spent a lot of time preparing them. He tells you that you need masterful understanding of the concepts and the terms to do well in the course, which is exactly what you need. It was a pleasure to learn from him. Sad that he is retiring.

This class may seem easy... until you get to the exams. They are VERY tricky and there is JUST enough time to finish them, IF AND ONLY IF you use your time wisely. Average on the first midterm was about 17/36, which he says is normal. He seems to enjoy having his students suffer... study hard, and you won't be one of those students.

Horban's Phil 110 class Is extremely hard! I'm outside of the major and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The exams are only 40 minutes and you don't have time to get through it all! Its ridiculous. I'm sure he's a nice guy but the class is super hard.

I took 5 courses this semester, I had 4.0 GPA and I got B in this course. His exams are tricky, VERY TRICKY. Expect to know the unexpected and answer questions you do not understand. Don't be deceived by easy lecture material, do all questions in textbook and pray that you will do okay on midterms. This course seems illogically unfair to me
he is a very excellent teacher!!! fantastic, gentleman, have sense of humor!!! must take his course~!

Professor Horban is fantastic.  His voice is pleasant. He is very friendly and easy-going.    However, just be wary that during midterms, he gives a "two minute warning" make sure you have your test ready to hand in. Lateness is not acceptable. Some people complain about the difficulty.  PHIL 110 is hard, but he does a great job of teaching it.
The worst professor I have ever had. I have never ever seen any rude, mean teacher like this idiot!!!!!

He was completely rude and cold towards me when I tried to explain that the TA skipped my row and the exams in my hand are NOT LATE! He first of all ignored me and warned me with a threatening tone to walk away from the situation and not get into it. Completely irrational way of collecting exams- many errors can be made on TAs side. Unfairness.

To the poster below, that is fair. He warns you many, many, many times prior to collecting assignments that if you don't have it ready as soon as the test is over, he'll penalize you. This keeps it fair for everyone else who stopped when he instructed us to.
the test are so freaking hard.he will take penalise if u hold the exam sheet in just one second when he comes to take ur paper.is that fair?

His lectures are amazingly crystal clear and perfectly paced. He is so knowledgeable about what he is teaching and can answer any question. Really anal about no cell phones in class, but he gave away money when he asked super hard questions in lecture which is crazy. I hope to take another course with him, he's great :)

To the person who said he/she got an A with 65%, you were probably one of those people got the wrong grade because of an uploading error. Dr. Horban is an extremely good prof; lectures are extremely useful. Midterms and final were hard, but not impossible to finish or to get a good grade. Try to understand  the material instead of memorizing it.

Peter is alright. Class was easy for me, but very hard. Average on midterm was 39%. It is very unfairly marked, but it is unfairly marked for every, and I ended up getting an A in the class with about 65%. I slept thru class most of the time so he is boring, but good.
Argh! Terrible, terrible, terrible. What a let down, too. Marks were messed up at the end of the year! Never taking a course with him again!
Exams are extremely difficult.

This class is no GPA booster, and it's not for Arts kids looking for an easy Q credit. I did get money, however, for asking him a question in lecture. My TA is terrible, and Dr. Horban doesn't seem to want to help - so if you like logic, take this course. If not, STAY FAR AWAY!

Prof. Horban is an very good lecturer, but the educational purpose of his grading scale and brutal exams is illusive.  Highly inept TAs were also an issue in this course.  There is probably a much easier "Q"-Breadth course out there.

He really cares about making sure the students learn in his lectures and always answers questions without making the student who asked them feel stupid. My TA is awful but I always look forward to the lectures, even if I can't always get my head around them.

As previously stated, he does have a movie theatre voice! I found it helpful to pre-read the assigned reading even though he works the other way around. That way, his lectures won't feel so fast. Likes his job, wants his students to LEARN. My TA sucks so it's a good thing Horban's a good prof. Take this course seriously, though. It's not easy.
He's a great prof. Knows how to teach, has a sense of humor so you wouldn't be bored out of your mind. You do your homework and keep up with readings/lectures you should be fine.

It's kind of hard to grasp the concept at first, but once you do, everything is so much clearer. His notes are really helpful and he knows his stuff. In lecture, make sure your cell is on silent and don't use it openly. Mid-terms are kind of tricky so do your homework.
No Comments
Great professor, though you may be lulled by his movie theatre voice.

If your a normal student. i.e. not a phil major.. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. the teacher was ok, but he made the course harder than it had to be. If phil is a required class for ur major take phil 120 or something. AVOID THIS CLASSS

Horbans a good prof, smart guy, and knows exactly what he's talking about, meaning he is extremely picky and very precise. Which leads to veryy hard mid terms/finals. In order to do well in this class, really wrap your mind on the material and know it inside out. Remember this class is not a gpa booster!

this class was a HUGE mistake!! for anybody taking the class as a gpa booster,THINK AGAIN.he had 2 midterms which were almost the same exact questions ..and teh final was VERY similar to the final.. MC questions were MESSED UP u had a 1/84chance per question it really screwed me over. and plus u learn about symbols like A.B wth is that useful for??

This class is fun, if you like logic.  It's easy to follow until you come to the tests.....They are extremely hard and way more advanced than the questions you do in the tutorials.  Its a very unfair representation of your knowledge of the class.  And you dont have nearly enough time to complete it.

lecture was ok and the examples that he used were confusing, you can easily get the concept from reading throught the text. His exams were hard and the way he graded was werid...dont really know how him and his TA Richard grade students..
No Comments

Material was fairly easy, expecially if you do the homework exercises. Lectures were sometimes painfully slow, reading the textbook usually acheived the same results. Interesting stuff if you're into problem solving.

Very good professor, explains all the concepts in a clear way in which it is easy to understand. Though it's quite difficult to finish his midterms on time, the course is scaled so as long as you understand the material well, you'll do fine.

Hey Horban, listen up!  You'd be fun to have as a grandfather, talking about all your experiences and theories.  But your classes are dreadfully boring.  Your tests are brutal. Heres my philosophy: Philosophers are people with arts degrees who have no other skills besides essay writing who create imaginary problems to make a living.
No Comments
RUTHLESS

lectures are very boring, always make you feel sleepy. Exams are too hard, especially for midterms you don't have time to finish them. You can barely get marks on the Multiple choice part. The only good thing is his TAs are great, I actually found TAs are more helpful than Peter Horban himself
so difficult. with this course you either get it or you don't. his teaching style is through but testing is brutal. the all or nothing multiple choice were ridiculous. never take a class from him!

Lectures were very clear.  Exams were difficult but I liked them. Made you work beyond simple memorization. My only complaint is that the homework assignments don't help you get ready for the exam. You don't really need the textbook if you go to lectures.

It was a very hard class, although his lectures were clear--but his exams were way too hard for so little time. Taking Phil 110 was definitely a waste of time and effort, and it's one of things that I'll always regret doing in my university career. Too many exams, too little time, very tough prof, very tough course. A very unhappy student.

His lectures are clear and easy to read, BUT his exams are way hard. U do not have enough time to finish his exams. I knew how to do all the questions but there was just not enough time. Here is a hint of how hard they are: Half the class got less then 50% . The average was 19 out of 36. There is no "paper" that can bump up your grade!
So far so good. Very clear with what he teaches and is always willing to help out with any problems. I have yet to experience his exams, so therefore; i dont know much about them at this point.
What you do on your math course, what you do on this course.
Horban gets off on making quizzes really, really hard.  Thanks goodness for the bell curve!  Also, I am not a fan of teachers who cover parts of the overhead sheet.
This is a hard class!!! Four simple words... Less talk more Rock
This is not an easy course.  A lot of the material is very confusing, but Peter does a good job of explaining it.  Tests are very difficult - tricky questions, and not enough time to finish either!
his lectures are very well structured.
only take his class if you don't care about your GPA and don't mind retaking classes
course content is not useful at all in real life applications.  my recommendation is don't take it
a notes taking courses!!!!!!! Don't even know wut I was writting about!!!
No Comments
best prof ever
Dr. Evil, you have done it again!!!!
EXCLUSIVE OR!!!! Dammit, they do exist. Even the text book agrees. Why not you&#
Smart guy, tricky tests, fast writer, you either get it or you don't.
The question remains: is he trying to be Spock or Data?
Hard. I had to retake the course again. You HAVE to be awake during this class!!
I can still hear his announcer voice..
Spock wants to weed out non-vulcans. Exams look nothing like textbook.
I regret the day I walked into his class
Enjoys to see students suffer
BEST lecturer I've had. Tricky exams, however.

Phil is seriously the sweetest guy and one of the best philosophy profs I've had. He's understanding and tries his best to make logic as easy as possible for you. He provided a great online textbook and comprehensive notes and slides. He can be hard to follow at times but you'll learn lot from him. He is funny too. I personally respect him.

Like a lot of PHIL classes, a lot of times you seem to get it or just not... Class was a reverse bell curve, so it reflected that completely. Tutorials were helpful and assignments are easy, but midterms never was enough time... It's not content you normally would use/help you outside the subject, so know what you are getting into...
Great prof, has real interest in what he's doing.

Jillian is a good prof. She cares about her students and is always accessible for extra help. The clicker questions helped me a lot with understanding the lecture materials. As long as you attend lectures /tutorials, do your homeworks, and keep up with the class you'll be fine!
Avoid this prof at all costs, GPA downer.. super curved class with failing averages.

Worst class ever. She's  a terrible prof with bad taste in music. Avoid this class and her if you can. It is a nightmare and a torture just to withstand her lectures. Plus the midterm and final were so difficult that she had to scale the marks just so half the class wouldn't fail. Not to mention she ridicules the class if we don't understand.
she was a pretty good prof, but i hated the course to death. it's one of those courses where you get it or you don't (i didn't, obviously. but i passed).
